revised_title: Designing Artificial Receptors for Complexation and Controlled Aggregation
tldr: The article discusses the design of artificial receptors that use directed hydrogen bonding interactions in competitive solvents. The authors present simple synthetic receptors that function via hydrogen bonding in highly competitive solvents and demonstrate their use in inducing discrete 2+2 aggregates stabilized by a network of hydrogen bonds. The study of these artificial receptors provides insights into the underlying chemistry of molecular recognition and has potential applications in the design of molecule-selective sensors and interference with physiological processes.
